result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Joanne M Randell was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

superMiscConds.notes: Cash bail previously posted applied, balance to be paid as a condition of extended supervision

DNA surcharge paid in full.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended

Absolute sobriety, random UA's

No use or possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia

All prescriptions to be filled at the same pharmacy

Become involved in AA within the first 30 days of extended supervision and obtain a sponsor within the first 60 days

Attend AA on a weekly basis

Operate a motor vehicle only with a valid driver's license

Pay financial obligations in this case and in 22TR63

No new law violations
Maintain/obtain full-time employment (35 hrs per week) within the first 30 days of extended supervision

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

records.addlTxt:
8:47 AM Defendant Joanne M Randell in court.  Attorney Christopher Lee Hartley in court for Joanne M Randell.  Attorney Mary Caitlin Brejcha in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for Jury Trial.
Jurors called for and court takes recess at 8:50.
Trial resumed at 9:17.
Discussion regarding the location listed in the information.  State filed an amended information to correct the location.  Defense acknowledges receipt of the amended information, waives further reading and enters a not guilty plea.
Discussion regarding the seating chart for the jurors.
Potential jurors arrived at 9:19 and sworn in on voir dire.
Court conducts voir dire.
State conducts voir dire.
Defense conducts voir dire.
Counsel exercise peremptory strikes.
13 jurors selected and sworn in to try the issues.
Jurors excused at 10:06.
Remaining potential jurors excused at 10:08.
Court takes recess at 10:09.
Trial resumed at 10:32.
Counsel have reached a stipulation regarding statements made by the defendant.
Jurors recalled at 10:37.
Court reads preliminary jury instructions.
Opening statements by the State.
Opening statements by the Defense.
State calls T.S. to the stand.  T.S. sworn in and testified on direct examination.
T.S. excused by the Court.
State calls Detective Timothy Wacker to the stand.  Detective Wacker sworn in and testified on direct examination.  Exhibit 1 marked.  
Court conducts sidebar.
Jurors excused at 11:31.
Discussion regarding agreements regarding other statements by defendant.
Court takes recess at 11:33.
Trial resumed and jurors recalled at 11:40.
Detective Wacker continued testifying on direct examination, cross examination, and redirect.
Exhibits 2 and 3 marked.
Jurors excused at 11:57.
Discussion regarding the timeline of the trial.
Detective Wacker continued testifying on further direct examination and further cross examination regarding 22TR63.
Exhibit 2 is offered and received as to the 22TR63 case only.
Detective Wacker excused by the Court.
Discussion regarding alternate juror.
Court takes recess at 12:05.
Trial resumed and jurors recalled at 1:18.
State calls Officer Adam Rhode to the stand.  Officer Rhode sworn in and testified on direct examination and cross examination.
Officer Rhode excused by the Court.
State calls Detective Christina Lafleur to the stand.  Detective Lafleur sworn in and testified on direct examination.  Exhibit 4 marked.
Detective Lafleur excused by the Court.
State calls Analyst Amy Rutgers to the stand.  Analyst Rutgers sworn in and testified on direct examination.  Exhibits 5 and 6 marked.
Analyst Rutgers excused by the Court.
Exhibits 1-6 offered and received by the Court.
State rests.
Jurors excused at 1:50.
Defense moves for directed verdict of acquittal without argument.
State objects without argument.
Court denies motion for directed verdict.
Defendant will not be testifying.
Court conducts colloquy with defendant.
Court holds jury instruction conference.
Jurors recalled at 2:14.
Defense rests.
Jurors excused and Court takes recess at 2:16.
Trial resumed at 2:40.
Parties review final changes to jury instructions.
Jurors recalled at 2:41.
Court reads jury instructions.
Closing arguments by the State.
Closing arguments by the Defense. 
Rebuttal by the State.
Court continues reading jury instructions.
Civilian bailiff sworn in.
Jurors excused to deliberate at 3:23.
Parties agree that exhibit 2 may not go into the jury room.  Exhibits 1, 3, 4, 5 or 6 may go into the jury room if requested but only if requested.
Court takes recess at 3:28.
Juror reach a verdict at 4:05.
Trial resumed and jurors recalled at 4:08.
Court reads verdicts.
Jurors find defendant guilty on Counts 1 and 2.
Court polls the jurors.
Court reads final jury instructions.
Jurors discharges at 4:16.
State moves for Judgment on the verdict for Count 1.
Defense moves for Judgment of Acquittal notwithstanding the verdict.
Court grants the motion for Judgment on the verdict on Count 1.
Court denies the motion for Judgment of Acquittal notwithstanding the verdict.
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1.  Count 2 is dismissed by operation of law.
Defendant would like to proceed to sentencing today.
Recommendations by the State.
Recommendations by the Defense.
Attorney Hartley reads statement by the defendant.

The Court Orders the Following:

Count 1:
72 Months Imprisonment (Credit - 4 days)
-	36 Months of Initial Confinement
-	36 Months of Extended Supervision

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

DL REVOCATION:  36 months.
IGNITITION INTERLOCK: 36 months.

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
-	AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
-	Absolute Sobriety; 
-	Random U.A.'s;
-	No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
-	All prescriptions to be filled at the same pharmacy
-	Maintain/Obtain full time employment (35 hours per week) within the first 30 days of extended supervision;
-	Become involved in AA within the first 30 days of extended supervision and obtain a sponsor within the first 60 days;
-	Attend AA on a weekly basis;
-	Operate a Motor Vehicle only with a Valid Driver's License;
-	Pay financial obligations in this case and in 22TR63
-	No new law violations;

FINE:  $ 8373.00

IID Surcharge: $ 50.00

DNA Surcharge: $ 250.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  Cash bail to be applied.  Any remaining financial obligations to be paid as a condition of extended supervision. Failure to pay;  will result in a civil judgment.

AODA Assessment and follow through	

Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
